newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugolavia's 1996 exports could hit $2 bln-official.
newsitem.headline: Yugolavia's 1996 exports could hit $2 bln-official.

text.p: Yugoslavia's exports could reach $2 billion by the end of the year, a Yugoslav Chamber of Commerce official said on Wednesday.

"It would be an increase of 16-20 percent against the previous year but well below projected 50-percent rise." Mira Lukic, secretary of the Chamber's board for economic cooperation with the world told Reuters.
Imports were expected to rise for another $200-300 million by the end of the year but probably would not exceed $3.5 billion, she added.
According to Lukic, exports grew 11.1 percent and imports 46.7 percent from January to October over the same period in 1995.

Yugoslavia recorded a trade deficit of $1.7 billion in the first ten months of the year, with imports amounting to $3.1 billion and exports $1.4 billion. -- Gordana Kukic, Belgrade Newsroom ++381 11 222 4254
